content.text: Set up the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1
**Fig. 1.1 (not to scale)**
The distance between the two crocodile clips is \(L\). The reading on the voltmeter is \(V\)
Adjust the position of crocodile clip F so that \(L\) is approximately \(45 \text{cm}\)
Close the switch
Record the value of \(L\) and the voltmeter reading \(V\)
Open the switch

Vary \(L\) in the range \(15.0 \text{cm} \leqslant L \leqslant 95.0 \text{cm}\) by adjusting the position of F. For each position of F, measure \(L\) and \(V\). Repeat until you have six sets of values of \(L\) and \(V\)
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(\frac{1}{L}\) and \(\frac{1}{V}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{V}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{L}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line

content.text: In this experiment, you will determine the resistivity of a metal
You are provided with two table tennis balls A and B, each attached to a string
The mass of A and its string is \(m\)
Use the balance to measure \(m\)
Attach the clamp to the stand using the boss
Place both strings between the two wooden strips and secure the wooden strips in the clamp, as shown in Fig. 2.1

Adjust the apparatus so that the bottoms of the two wooden strips are approximately \(50 \text{cm}\) above the bench and the bottoms of the two balls are approximately \(1.5 \text{cm}\) above the bench
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(\sqrt{d - b}\)
Release A so that it moves towards B
When A hits B, it causes B to move
At the maximum height of ball B, the vertical distance between the centre of B and the bench is \(H\), as shown in Fig. 2.3
Determine \(H\)
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(H\). Show your working
percentage uncertainty = .........%
With this arrangement of the apparatus, the total mass of A is equal to \(m\) measured in (a)
Record the total mass \(M\) of A
Calculate \(\sqrt{H - b}\)
Use the adhesive putty to attach the \(10.0 \text{g}\) slotted mass to A
The total mass \(M\) of A is now equal to the sum of \(m\) and the mass of the slotted mass
Displace A and adjust the position of the block so that, when they are touching, the centre of A is level with the top of the block, as shown in Fig. 2.2
Repeat (b)(iii) and (b)(v)
It is suggested that the relationship between \(H\), \(b\), \(m\), \(M\) and \(d\) is
where \(k\) is a constant
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\)

It is suggested that the percentage uncertainty in the values of \(k\) is \(15\%\)
Using this uncertainty, explain whether your results support the relationship in \((\mathbf{d})\)
Describe **four** sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
For any uncertainties in measurement that you describe, you should state the quantity being measured and a reason for the uncertainty
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate the movement of a ball
Describe **four** improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
